alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 8:20PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Saco affecting Phillips and Valley Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Milk River at Saco. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water starts flooding the Bjornberg Bridge fishing access site on the north side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 26.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM MDT Thursday was 26.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 23.6 feet early Saturday morning. It will then rise to 23.7 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will fall to 22.3 feet Monday evening then rise again. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.7 feet on 03/04/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 1100 AM MDT.
